comments: Its amazing\r With the blink of an eye\r I finally saw the light\r Its amazing\r That when the moment arrives\r You know you\'ll be alright\r Its amazing\r And I\'m sayin\' a prayer\r For the desperate hearts tonight
I found the ambience and decoration to be in line with many other typical Chinese-American restaurants. Excellent wonton soup and egg rolls. I would recommend this to my friends.

The Instructor was really absent throughout the course. Not very responsive to emails. This didn\'t bother me because I got an A on every assignment, but it did become a problem for others. Provided good feedback when grading my writing and even suggested that bc of my writing style, I might do well in 202A. But I\'m a Business major, so no thanks.

Abysmal. Doesn\'t allow anything from _Unearthed Arcana_. WTF did he have us buy the book? I don\'t understand the near-constant references to Vance. Encounter descriptions are minimal at best. Worse than Arneson by far (and he\'s dead).
Extremely hard grader, especially compared to any other professor teaching this class. A lot of useless assignments designed to waste your time. If possible, avoid this guy..

The classwork isn\'t that bad as long as you are committed to keep up and put in the effort. This class isn\'t a cakewalk - but Patton does make it harder than it needs to be. His comments become monotonous and aren\'t very helpful. If you\'ve good English skills and are a good student you\'ll do fine though.

Not overly impressed with Patton. I\'m doing very well in the class, but he\'s not helpful and doesn\'t "instruct" at all. He deliberately phrases his assignments and communication in a complicated manner to force you to interpret, take this course from someone other than Joel Patton.

He makes each week\'s assignments painfully unclear. I don\'t know what is due when, or even what the assignments consist of. I am currently in my 17th and 18 WC classes. Patton is the worst teacher I have had. He takes what should be easily digested information, and turns it into a universe of uncertainty and suffering. GPA - 3.92 (pre-Patton).
